title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: This document provides essential context for AI assistants working on the OFFER-HUB project.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: OFFER-HUB is a self-hosted payments orchestrator for marketplaces that provides escrow-protected payments and user balances without requiring marketplaces to build payment infrastructure. It's a monorepo containing both backend (NestJS) and frontend (Next.js) applications.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Design System: Soft depth with 2.5D surfaces shaped by light and shadow - Primary Color: 149A9B (teal) - The brand pulse - Background: F1F3F7 - Light canvas for neumorphic shadows - Shadow Physics: Light source at 145¬∞ (top-left) - Border Radius: 16px for containers, 12px for interactive elements

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Self-hosted only: No multi-tenant SaaS - Non-custodial: Funds locked in Trustless Work smart contracts on Stellar - Provider abstraction: Strategy pattern for crypto vs Airtm - Idempotency-first: All mutations require Idempotency-Key - State machines: Strict transitions for orders, escrows, disput

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Backend: - NestJS (TypeScript) - PostgreSQL (state, audit) - Redis (BullMQ, idempotency, SSE) - Stellar blockchain integration - Trustless Work escrow contracts Frontend: - Next.js 14+ (App Router) - Tailwind CSS 4 (with CSS variables) - TypeScript - Modern neumorphic design system

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Folders: kebab-case (e.g., auth-form/, user-dashboard/) - React Components: PascalCase.tsx (e.g., OfferCard.tsx) - Hooks: use-kebab-case.ts (e.g., use-client-auth.ts) - Utilities: kebab-case.ts (e.g., sanitize-html.ts)

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Booleans: isLoading, hasError, canPerformAction - Functions: camelCase (fetchUserDetails, handleSubmitForm) - Event Handlers: handle[Subject][Action] (e.g., handleEmailChange) - Props: on[Action] (e.g., onClose, onSubmit) - Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE (MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE) - Types: PascalCase (ApiResp

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: All API responses MUST follow the ApiResponse<T> structure: typescript { ok: boolean; // Quick success check code: number; // 1000: Success, 4001: Validation, 5000: Internal type: "success" | "error" | "warning"; title: string; // Short headline for UI message: string; // Explicit feedback data: T |

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Elevated (Raised): css / Light theme / box-shadow: 6px 6px 12px d1d5db, -6px -6px 12px ffffff; / Hover state / box-shadow: 2px 2px 4px d1d5db, -2px -2px 4px ffffff; Sunken (Inset): css box-shadow: inset 4px 4px 8px d1d5db, inset -4px -4px 8px ffffff;

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Primary (149A9B): Progress, primary buttons, active states - Secondary (002333): Navbar, sidebar, footer backgrounds - Accent (15949C): Gradients, status highlights - Text Primary (19213D): Headings, body content - Text Secondary (6D758F): Captions, placeholders

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - fadeInUp: 400ms ease-out, translateY(20px ‚Üí 0) - scaleIn: 300ms ease-out, scale(0.95 ‚Üí 1) - Staggered lists: 100ms delay per item

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Auth: API keys, scopes (read/write/support) - Users: Create/get/list, wallet auto-creation - Balance: Available + reserved, credit/debit operations - Orders: State machine, reserve funds, escrow coordination - Escrow: Trustless Work integration, fund/release/refund - Disputes: Open/resolve, suppor

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: 1. Deposit: User sends USDC ‚Üí Stellar address ‚Üí BlockchainMonitor ‚Üí balance credited 2. Order: Create ‚Üí reserve (available ‚Üí reserved) ‚Üí create escrow ‚Üí fund escrow 3. Work: Order IN_PROGRESS 4. Resolution: - Release: 3 Stellar txs ‚Üí seller balance credited - Refund: 2 Stellar txs ‚Üí buyer balance cr

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - API Keys: Bearer token, hashed in DB - Secrets: Never in responses or logs - Idempotency: Prevent duplicate charges - Webhooks: HMAC verification - Wallet Keys: AES-256-GCM encrypted - Audit: All mutations logged with redaction

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Component: ErrorState - Colors: text-error, RING_ERROR - Must provide onRetry button - Message: Explain what happened and how to fix

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Component: Toast or StatusBadge - Colors: text-success, bg-success/10 - Icon: Check mark - Message: Short, affirmative

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Use skeleton components - Match exact dimensions of final component - Prevent layout shift (CLS)

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: - Centered icon - Encouraging message - Primary CTA button

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Location: src/data/ Every domain must export: - [DOMAIN]_MOCK_SUCCESS: Full response payload - [DOMAIN]_MOCK_EMPTY: Empty data with total: 0 - [DOMAIN]_MOCK_ERROR: Error response with ResponseCode Use static IDs (usr_001, off_505) for determinism.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Orders, escrows, disputes, top-ups, and withdrawals all use strict state machines. Only valid transitions are allowed.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: PaymentProvider interface allows switching between crypto (default) and airtm via environment variable.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: All requests, orders, escrows, and provider calls are traceable via correlation IDs.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Internal event bus with SSE streaming for real-time updates.

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: ‚ùå Use flat drop shadows (use neumorphic physics) ‚ùå Use spaces or PascalCase for directories ‚ùå Return raw errors (use ApiResponse<T>) ‚ùå Skip idempotency keys on mutations ‚ùå Log or return secrets ‚ùå Use generic colors (red, blue, green) ‚ùå Create layout shift with loading states ‚ùå Skip error retry butto

title: AI Context for OFFER-HUB
content: Think of OFFER-HUB as: - Backend: The single API a marketplace talks to for payments and escrow - Frontend: A modern neumorphic dashboard for managing offers and transactions - Orchestrator: Coordinates state machines and provider calls, never holds escrow funds - Non-custodial: Funds are in user wa

content: Primary Brand Color: 149A9B Background: F1F3F7 Card Radius: 16px Button Radius: 12px Shadow Angle: 145¬∞ (top-left) Animation Duration: 400ms Stagger Delay: 100ms API Success Code: 1000 Validation Error Code: 4001 Internal Error Code: 5000 --- Remember: This project values visual excellence, strict c

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator is a self-hosted payments orchestrator for marketplaces. It provides a Web2-style experience (balance, top-ups, checkout, withdrawals) while delegating funds to external rails: Airtm (fiat) or Stellar + Trustless Work (crypto-native). Each marketplace runs its own instance; th

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Self-host only: Each marketplace deploys its own Orchestrator; no shared multi-tenant service. - Per-user funds (not pooled): Balances are attributed to users (Airtm per-user or Stellar invisible wallets), not to the marketplace pool. - Non-custodial escrow: Funds are locked in Trustless Work smar

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Ledger (balance): Per-user accounting of available and reserved amounts. In crypto mode the source of truth is on-chain; the Orchestrator mirrors it. In Airtm mode balance is derived from Airtm + local reserve tracking. - Providers: External systems the Orchestrator calls: Trustless Work (escrow o

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Auth: API keys (create/list/revoke via master key), scopes (read, write, support), optional short-lived tokens. - Users: Create/get/list users; link Airtm (airtm mode); in crypto mode wallet auto-created on registration. - Balance: Get/sync per-user balance (available + reserved); reserve/release

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Crypto (default): Deposit USDC to user's Stellar address ‚Üí detected by BlockchainMonitor ‚Üí balance credited. Order: create ‚Üí reserve (available ‚Üí reserved) ‚Üí create escrow (deploy contract, platform signs) ‚Üí fund escrow (buyer signs, reserved ‚Üí on-chain) ‚Üí IN_PROGRESS. Resolution: release (3 tx: s

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - PaymentProvider (Strategy): initializeUser, isUserReady, getBalance, getDepositInfo, signEscrowTransaction, sendPayment. Implementations: CryptoNativeProvider (wallets + Stellar + TW), AirtmProvider (future, Airtm API). - Selection: PAYMENT_PROVIDER=crypto (default) or airtm; injected at bootstrap

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Users: Identity, type (buyer/seller/both), optional Airtm link; in crypto mode linked to Wallet. - Wallets (crypto): Per-user Stellar keypair; public key stored; secret encrypted (AES-256-GCM) with WALLET_ENCRYPTION_KEY. - Balances: available, reserved; one logical balance per user. - Orders: buye

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Trustless Work: Escrow API (deploy, fund, milestone, release, dispute, resolve). Required. Webhook optional; Orchestrator can rely on synchronous API responses. - Stellar Horizon: Balance and payment streaming (crypto mode). Deposit detection for invisible wallets. - Airtm: Top-ups (payins), withd

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Top-up (airtm): POST /topups ‚Üí confirmation URI ‚Üí user pays in Airtm ‚Üí webhook ‚Üí balance credited. - Deposit (crypto): User sends USDC to wallet address ‚Üí BlockchainMonitor ‚Üí balance credited. - Checkout (order): POST /orders ‚Üí POST reserve ‚Üí POST escrow ‚Üí POST escrow/fund ‚Üí (work) ‚Üí POST resoluti

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Auth: API key (Bearer); scopes read/write/support; master key for creating keys; keys hashed in DB. - Secrets: Provider and wallet keys only in env; not logged or returned. - Idempotency: Prevents duplicate charges; key reuse with different body returns 409. - Webhooks: HMAC verification (Airtm, T

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Available balance: Amount user can spend or reserve. - Reserved balance: Amount locked for orders (not yet in escrow). - Escrow (TW): Soroban contract on Stellar holding USDC until release/refund/resolve. - Invisible wallet: Server-side Stellar keypair; user does not sign in browser; Orchestrator

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: - Not a centralized payment SaaS: Each marketplace runs its own instance. - Not a generic wallet app: It is an orchestrator for marketplace flows (orders, escrow, balance). - Not a blockchain node: It uses Horizon and Trustless Work APIs; it does not run Stellar core. - Not a replacement for Airtm o

title: OFFER-HUB Orchestrator ‚Äî System Context
content: Think of the Orchestrator as the single backend a marketplace talks to for "payments and escrow." It keeps per-user balances and order/escrow state, and calls out to Trustless Work (and optionally Airtm) to move money. It never holds escrow funds itself; in crypto mode it holds encrypted keys to sig

title: OFFER-HUB Documentation
content: When updating documentation: - Keep language clear and technical - Use code examples where applicable - Update this index when adding new documents - Maintain consistent formatting across documents - All documentation must be in English
